page.title: 11Fishing
page.content: The{inshore waters}of the Solway Firth are recognised{fish breeding}and nursery grounds. Only small inshore boats, of less than 45 feet, are allowed to fish within the Sea Fisheries District of Cumbria which extends from Meikle Ross in Scotland to St Bees Head in England. This District is controlled by Cumbria County Council, who enforce the Byelaws and carry out sampling with the aid of a{protection vessel,}the 'Solway Protector'. This vessel, with a crew of two, is a 40" twin screw patrol boat and is based at Workington Harbour. The majority of fishermen are part-time and use the Harbour as their base. Catches include cod, herring, skate, dabs, lobster, crabs, shrimps and prawns. Fisherman complain that inshore{pollution}is a problem.
